title: Viral Integration Analysis Reveals Likely Common Clonal Origin of Bilateral HPV16-Positive, p16-Positive Tonsil Tumors
patient: A 60-year-old female nun in Cologne, Germany presented with bilateral p16-positive OPSCCs of the tonsils. The left tonsil was diagnosed as pT2N2bcM0, the right as pT2N0M0, both Grade 2. Combined radio-chemotherapy was recommended, but only radiotherapy was performed (59.5/50.4Gy) because the patient refused chemotherapy. The patient was free of disease at her last visit to the clinic two years post-diagnosis, after which she was lost to follow up but was reported to have died approximately one year later due to pneumonia.
